newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico says 6 bidders for Toluca natgas transport.
newsitem.headline: Mexico says 6 bidders for Toluca natgas transport.

text.p: Six consortia are bidding for the concession to distribute natural gas in the industrial center of Toluca, in Mexico state, Mexico's Energy Regulatory Commission (CRE) said on Thursday.
The distribution is currently controlled by state oil and gas monopoly Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex).
-- Mexico's Centra Gas de Toluca, Canada's WestCoast Energy Inc. and the United States' Coastal Gas Toluca.
-- France's Gaz de France Intl and Mexico's Mexigas.
-- Mexico's Consorcio Sistema Automatico de Gas, Toluca Disco Holding and the United States' Enova Corp.
-- Mexico's Grupo Mexicano de Desarollo SA, Canada's Gas International, and the United States' Shell Oil Company.
-- The United States' NorAm Energy Corp and Mexico's Gutsa Construcciones.

Toluca is slated to be the fourth in a series of privatizations of natural gas distribution rights. A total of $100 million is expected in investments for the site, with $50 million for the distribution lines and $50 million to build a supply pipeline from Palmillas, near Queretaro.
Natural gas distribution rights in the Hermosillo region of Sonora state were sold earlier this month to Denver-based KN Energy, and two other privatizations were carried out in the last six months.
